text: (Bouteille provenant du Whole Foods Pasadena): Minéraux, force anisée, amandes et des traces de sucre blanc enveloppés dans une feuille de riz. Lanis est très dominant, soyez avertis.

Sampled at Astor Wines. Stemmy wine glass. Pretty Japanese women of proper childbearing age.

Thin, murky almond/coconut milk consistency. Short soda fizzle.

Scent of apples, bitter orange, licorice, clay.

White grapes, grapefruit. More tart then acidic. A bitterness, more fruity like tarragon then anise. Had sort of a stiff mimosa quality to it.

Short, popping carbonation. Starchy. Yeasty. Short alcohol.

Tall glasses of this in the morning seem quite appropriate.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

text: Bottle. Milky white color. Aroma of rice paper. Taste is very subtle anise, almond. Easy drinking.
(360ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy milky white body.  Aroma of coconut, marzipan, and pineapple.  Flavor of marzipan, earth, rice, pineapple, and coconut.
Bottle. Pours a hazy milky white color with no head. Has a fruity spicy rice aroma with milky hints. Fruity sparkling spicy rice flavor. Has a fruity spicy sparkling rice finish.

Thanks to Kyotolefty! Pours a skim milk white.  Aroma of unripe melon, sweet wild flowers, very herbal and floral.  Almost a pine note in the flavor, some sweetness and again a sticky sweet floral flavor.  Cool stuff!

Pours a hazy, milky white color with a small white head.  Amazing fruitiness on the nose, a hint of anise, white wine, light alcohol, and a mild herbal quality.  Quite sweet, with a bit of sugar.  The flavor is lightly herbal, almost a bit of gin, alcohol, sugar, and anise.  This one is a little bit boozy/hot.  Not quite as fruity as the nose, but the flavor is still quite good.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours hazy white with a small white head. Smooth fruity and crisp aroma. Wineous and fruity. Carbonated. Lingering fruity and crisp into the finish.
From bottle at Sakebar, Paris. Milky colours, small bubbles. A bit of anise, some coconut, a hint of fruit. Complex.

Bottle at Chriso Pre GBBF shindig 2011.  Milky white colour.  Aniseed aroma, more like a gin in the flavour.  Tasty if a touch hot on the alcohol.  Lovely complexity.  Very tasty and rather drinkable.  Good

Bottle 360ml. @ chriso s Pre-GBBF Shindig 2011.Unclear milk white colour with no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, pineapple, light earty rice, fruit notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, anisseed, coconut, rice, pineapple - fruit. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is fizzy, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20110730]

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2012 Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig, 2011. 
Sweet, with big fruits, interesting flavor of milk, coconuts, sweet pineapple, anise seed. Fizzy and tingly in a pleasant way. Not as refined as the regular 50, but fun and very tasty.

"Lonkero" colour, noi head. Aroma is mild anise, liquorice, some sweet fruity notes as well. Flavour is anise, liquorice, mild coconut as well as soem slight sweet notes.

Bottle at ChrisOs Pre-GBBF Shindig 2011. Pours cloudy white. Big anise, licorice character to this guy. Creamy sugar in the flavor, underscored by that anise. Medium to full bodied with restrained, sparkling carbonation. Big warming finish, slight sting. Interesting and nifty.
Bottle at Chris Os pre GBBF shindig, 2011. Nice pineapple and lemon aroma. Dry, fruity vibe. Gin like in character. Smooth.
bottle at chriss ... light hazy white ... clear fizzyness ... soft fruits ... light earthy rice... hint of aniseed ... light alcohol ... soft coconut ...

A Mes rate. At Chris Os pre GBBF.Hats off to Mark for bringing the sakes. I admit to being quite excited to try my sparkling sake. This does not disappoint. Lovely floral character, very gin like. Incredible mouthfeel. Creamy but sparkling. A completely new experience for me. Lightly sweet coconut finish. Really interesting.
